lecho.lib.hellocharts.formatter

Interface AxisValueFormatter

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SimpleAxisValueFormatter 

    public interface AxisValueFormatter

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int formatValueForAutoGeneratedAxis(char[] formattedValue, float value, int autoDecimalDigits)
      Used only for auto-generated axes.
      int formatValueForManualAxis(char[] formattedValue, AxisValue axisValue)
      Formats AxisValue for manual(custom) axis.

    • Method Detail

      • formatValueForManualAxis

        int formatValueForManualAxis(char[] formattedValue,
                             AxisValue axisValue)
        Formats AxisValue for manual(custom) axis. Result is stored in (output) formattedValue array. Method returns number of chars of formatted value. The formatted value starts at index [formattedValue.length - charsNumber] and ends at index [formattedValue.length-1].

      • formatValueForAutoGeneratedAxis

        int formatValueForAutoGeneratedAxis(char[] formattedValue,
                                    float value,
                                    int autoDecimalDigits)
        Used only for auto-generated axes. If you are not going to use your implementation for aut-generated axes you can skip implementation of this method and just return 0.
        Formats values with given number of digits after decimal separator. Result is stored in given array. Method returns number of chars for formatted value. The formatted value starts at index [formattedValue.length - charsNumber] and ends at index [formattedValue.length-1].
